data.title: Not as good as our first visit
data.text: This was our second time dining here and the first time was so great we couldn't wait to get back.  I was a little disappointed this time as the atmosphere wasn't as warm and fuzzy as the first time.  We felt rushed and the gentleman who worked behind the bar and also waited some tables was not very personable.  In the middle of a conversation he left while my husband was still talking to him, he seemed "checked out" for the night.  The food was good, but not great...we didn't rave about it as much as we did last year when we left.  Overall it was a let down, an average dining experience for too much money. I am from a foody town and competition is out there...you can't lose sight of why you made to where you are or you won't be there long.

data.title: Doesn't live up to the hype
data.text: We went with another couple who heard about Jimmys and said it's very hard to get reservations and very exclusive so we were expecting and exceptional dining experience.  The place is tiny and the menu is on a blackboard which is fine. Our server was a bit odd.  He kind of haunted us to hurry up and order.  They probably like turning over the tables as quickly as possible since it is so small. The 2 people in our party who ordered the fish specials were pleased with their meals.  I had shrimp etouffe which was not good and my friend had the hanger steak which she did not care for at all. The tomato bisque with puff pastry was outstanding! As other reviewers said, with so many great places in Delray Beach, I would not plan to return to Jimmys.

data.title: A Real Gem!
data.text:
I love Jimmy's for so many reasons. It is a small family owned restaurant so you do need a reservation if possible so you can have at a table otherwise you will sit at the bar and that is alright, too.

They have daily specials on a big black board and they serve, Italian, New Orleans style  food as well as fresh seafood caught daily and some Asian dishes as well.

I went there twice during my 6 night visit to Delray and I ordered the homemade chicken ravioli which was heavenly along with the homemade tomato and freshly mad mozzarella with a fabulous. The first time Julie, Matthew and Jimmy were there and it was such a highlight to meet them. They also have an excellent team who cares about their customers. Everything on the menu is amazing and they also have a nice wines by the glass or bottle. They do not serve cocktails so have one before you go as they serve beer and wine only.

data.title: Eclectic!!
data.text: Had a very good dinner. The menu is printed on a blackboard,I had to stand to read it. The Asian dumplings were delicious. The swordfish was also very good. My husband had pork spietzal excellent. The menu was all over the place but everything we tried was very good. My only complaint was that it was a mob seen had to wait outside with a reservation. Might of been that it was a Friday night. Next time will try on a week night!

data.title: GREAT!
data.text:
While visiting Del Ray Beach, my friend and I went to Jimmy's Bistro and both had a delicious dinner. So delicious we made 
reservations for our next three nights.  
The warm fresh bread was a wonderful beginning. I ordered chicken with a balsamic reduction and it was excellent.  After tasting my friend's fish with beurre blanc sauce, I ordered that the next night. Wonderful!
The strawberry dessert was unforgettable!  Get a reservation and eat here!  It's great!

data.title: Great spot off the Avenue
data.text:
We've been to Jimmy's Bistro a few times and have always had a positive experience.  I like that it's off the hustle bustle of Atlantic Avenue.  The restaurant itself is very small but we never felt crowded in.  The menu changes and is written on a chalkboard above the bar.
Their fish comes from a local fisherman (they have a market in Delray - Captain Clay's) and I recommend ordering if fish is your thing.  I have also ordered the duck.  I agree with many of the posters that it is simply delicious BUT pricey.  I think it's the most expensive entree on the menu at $36.  My husband had the pork schnitzel which was huge and also delicious. The ceviche appetizer is wonderful but the portion is rather small so order more than one if you are going to share with more than 2 people.  
Overall this is a great spot worth trying.

data.title: good food good times
data.text:
Very Kool
perhaps a bit too close together
mostly hits especially the half duck
too thin swordfish was sent back and replaced with a wonderful Mahi Mahi
overall great
chef owned always wins

data.title: The Book & the Cover
data.text:
You walk up to this place and think this must not be the place we heard such good things about.  The appearance from the outside was about as unimpressive as you can imagine.  Then you walk inside and your initial impression does not change.  So, enough about the cover.  Now to the Book.  WOW - this place is great from start to finish.  First we were greeted by Julie, the very lovely, sweet and personable young lady that called earlier to confirm our reservation.  Then, after we chose our table (we were told to take any table of 4 that was sill open) Julie took our wine order but was soon replace by our waiter, Peter.  Again, so nice, so friendly and so very helpful in guiding us through the evenings food choices (the menu is on a chalkboard and constantly changes).  The first thing Peter brought to the table was the bread.  No, not just ordinary bread, but super good with a real crusty crust.  I already know, just from the bread, that I am going to like this place.  

My dinner began with their Delray Cerviche - just great containing swordfish.  My main course,  at Peter's suggestion, was the Rabbit.  Thanks, great suggestion.  Others in our party got Beef Short Ribs, Seafood Pasta, and Beurre Blanc Fish.  We finished by sharing a strawberry and a banana tart.  So what is there to say? - Everything we had was terrific.  Unusual, but everyone of our group really loved what they got and we all expect to come back.  Also note:  they allow you, for a $25. corkage fee, to bring your own bottle of wine.  The food here is at such a high level that you might want to bring a special bottle and pay the modest charge.

As we finished, guess who cam by our table?  Jimmy, of course.  And, it didn't seem like a perfunctory visit - he too was just so affable it was now obvious why all the staff was so nice, friendly, and - importantly - professional and knowledgeable.   I will see you all again.

data.title: Small and intimate...
data.text: This place is small and intimate but has so many great dishes.  They have a tomato bisque with a pastry on top that is so amazing, I would go there just to have that.  Every dish I have had is amazing and the staff is spot on all time.  The range and style of the dishes will def meet whatever you are crving.  I will/do go back there.

data.title: Local just off the Avenue gem"
data.text:
Jimmy's is a quaint bistro with very flavorful food.  They offer a wide range from Pasta dishes, lamb, fish and great salads.  Wine or beer is served.  My only suggestion to Jimmys would be to change the menu board more frequently so we can go more often.  

Owner and Staff are awesome! Fun place, especially when Jimmy makes a surprised appearance!

data.title: Warm and welcoming astmosphere
data.text: I visited Jimmy's for the fist time last night with 6 other girlfriends for our Christmas get together.  Our waitress was wonderful, she accommodated our every request with a smile. Even giving us separate checks (which I am sure is a pain).  All our food was excellent.  Our table ordered the Ravioli, Short Ribs, Seafood Pasta and one of the fresh fish dishes.  We all cleaned our plates.  We tried both desserts they offered.  One was prepared with Bananas & Chocolate and one with a Strawberry Balsamic reduction.  Both were truly yummy but I would return daily for the Strawberry!  The prices are a tad on the higher end but worth every penny.

data.title: Delicious homey spot
data.text:
We were lucky to get a table at this fun spot at the last minute. The service was amazing and very warm. We had our 99 year old grandpa with us and they were so accommodating of him.
The food was delicious --- tomato soup, pear salad, different fishes and so much more!
We will definitely return!

data.title: Nice Oasis for Intimate Dinner
data.text: Went to Jimmy's for first time this week. Menu is written on blackboard. Food was interesting and fresh--fish, pastas, meats. All four of us enjoyed our meals (ravioli, pasta bolognese, duck and snapper). But the best part of the meal was the dessert--banana tart with chocolate and ice cream.

data.title: Over Priced
data.text: When entering the restaurant, we were greeted with half a smile. We ordered drinks (beer and wine only) and dinner.  Although other tables had bread, we had to ask for it.  Within just a few minutes dinner arrived with our bread which gave us no time whatsoever to relax and enjoy our drinks. My overpriced shrimp etoufee ($32.00) came with six shrimp and a watery but tasty sauce.  In general, Starters and Entrees (although tasty) were overpriced and the staff was mechanical.  No desire to return.

data.title: wonderful little place!!!
data.text: Zucchini Flowers!!!! yum...haven't had those since Brooklyn. The tomato bisque soup alone is reason to try Jimmys.

data.title: If you love fresh fish and food prepared with care, in a small venue, this is a must try.
data.text:
What a fantastic "foodie" delight. The menu is on the blackboard and lists all of the daily fresh fish catches, but any of the appetizers or entree's are delicious. We've bee here a few times in the past couple of months and really enjoyed it. It's not 'scene' to be seen at, but more of a great meal in a small casual venue. Some of the reviewers complained about the service, but I really don't know what they are talking about. the service during our dinners has been excellent, but then I am not looking for my server to be my best friend either. They were knowledgeable about the menu, the specials and would offer recommendations if you weren't sure which of their delicious items to choose from.
Last visit had the pork stuffed dumplings for an appetizer and the best fresh swordfish I've had in a long time.
Their wine list is adequate and they don't kill you on the bottle prices.
If you need to be part of the Atlantic avenue 'scene' this is probably not for you. If you want to have a GREAT dinner in a small, quite, casual ambiance with food prepared with care this is a must try.
We choose to sit at the 'bar' since it is usually just my wife and I when we go here, but it only seats 10 people and the restaurant does not have a 'bar' scene, it is strictly for dining.

data.title: Food very good. Service very poor.
data.text: Sat at the bar with a friend. We ordered the sea bass and scallops. Both were quite delicious. Fish was cooked nicely and well presented, scallops the same. That's it nothing more, nothing less. The service was a complete turn off. There were only a few tables seated, the service was slow and the waiter was indifferent at best and by Florida standards rude. I would never go back. I live in Delray. There are many terrific restaurants why choose one where you are treated so poorly and nothing seriously special about the food.

data.title: Run, Don't Walk to Jimmy's Bistro
data.text: Been living in Delray Beach for many years; heard about Jimmy's Bistro, but for some reason, never dined here.  Tonight my boyfriend and I decided to finally make a reservation, and are we glad we did.  Each course was sublime, the staff, Peter and Jackie, exceptionally helpful, and the restaurant, while small, has a great vibe.  The meal was so memorable, we actually made a reservation for New Year's Eve 2015, six months in advance.  Now that's a big recommendation.

data.title: One of the absolute best in Palm Beach County
data.text: This has to be one of the best restaurants in Palm Beach County. It is quite small, so make a reservation. Sit at the bar, if you like, also. The wines are wonderful, the ever-changing menu on the chalk board at the bar offers an amazing variety of perfectly prepared food, The bread is delicious and desserts are beautiful creations. We have never had a meal here that was anything but outstanding. We go back often because it is so reliably consistent. We cannot praise it too much. It is a love affair.

data.title: The Best
data.text:
Eat here about 5 times a month.  I have eaten in every restaurant in Delray many
times.  This is one of the most fun, relaxed, and top quality places you will eat.
Jimmy is highly trained ( French/NYC ) chef.  Great food & and very good wine.
